summary: This is an internal DOJ email from July 18, 2019, forwarding a voicemail attachment from a public intake line. The email notes the caller references the Epstein case but is making a complaint about a separate matter, which should be processed as a civilian complaint. The original voicemail is attached.

events.title: Voicemail received on DOJ intake line
events.description: A voicemail is received on a Department of Justice intake line where the caller references the Epstein case but makes a complaint about a separate matter.

keyFacts: On July 18, 2019, a voicemail was received on a DOJ intake line referencing the Epstein case.
The DOJ employee processing the message determined the caller's complaint was about a separate matter, not directly related to the Epstein case.
The email instructs the recipient to process the voicemail as a standard civilian complaint.
The document shows the DOJ was receiving public communications referencing Epstein in July 2019, requiring internal routing and assessment.
